'''{{Pagename nd}}''' is a {{lc:Journal}} in {{poe2}}.

##  Description 

{{Description |{{#var:description}}}}

##  Acquisition 

{{#arraymap: {{#var:location}}|;|x|x|\n}}

## Usage

* Contains a clue as to the whereabouts of [Arkemyr's Old Robe](/arkemyrsOldRobe/), which can be used to trick the imps roaming the manor into thinking you're their master.
* Alludes to the passphrase "cider and cheese", though you'll need to read [Arkemyr's Notes](/arkemyrsNotes/) to actually use it.
raw:
{{Infobox item poe2
| name           = Fassina's Journal 
| icon           = poe2 journal_black icon.png
| description    = The misery of this apprenticeship... madiccho. Arkemyr saves only the most tedious errands for me. If I'm not going to learn anything from this trial, I must find some way to steal enjoyment from it.

Whenever Arkemyr claims to be "deep in study" I will find him wandering the halls wearing an illusory face to trick his imps. Fools them every time. Sometimes I think he came to the Deadfire to be alone with those nasty things, and he spites me for getting in the way of his fun.

Shortly after he left town, I stole one the robes he keeps in his bedroom. The imps thought I was their master. Fed me cheese and ale for the rest of the afternoon. Of course I returned the robe when I was done. Ac, maybe it's not too late to start enjoying myself.
| added_in       = poe2
| equipment_slot = Unequippable
| item_type      = Journal
| item_category  = Other item
| requirements   = 
| is_soulbound   = no
| is_unique      = no

}}
